109825189.review:
이 DLC는 궁정, 유물, 문화 시스템이 추가가 되었는데

유물과 문화 시스템은 무난하게 좋다고 느껴졌고 이것만으로도 즐길 거리가 많이 늘었다고 생각되지만, 
궁정 시스템이 너무 실망스럽다.

온갖 궁정 전용 상호작용이 가능할 거라 생각했는데 그런 건 일체 없었고 그냥 가만히 숨만 쉬고 서있는 게 전부요,
시점을 자유롭게 전환해서 온갖 멋진 장면을 뽑아낼 수 있을 거란 기대감도 그냥 무참히 짓밟을 정도로 너무 제한적인 목각인형 같은 방 한칸 짜리 궁정 컨텐츠인 것이었다.

궁정에서 하는 상호작용은 그냥 기존에도 밖에서 해온 것들을 그대로 가져왔다고 해도 무방할 정도로 별 것 아닌 것들이다.
궁정 주최를 통해 몇가지 안건을 들어주거나, 가끔씩 뜨는 팝업을 해결해주는 정도인데,
자기들 싸우는 걸 가지고 화해시켜주고, 궁정의사가 무덤 도굴했다고 신고들어오고, 명분이 있는 땅을 달라고 하는 정도에 그치는 수준이다. 이런 것들은 기존에도 있던 것들이고 그냥 단순히 넣을 게 없어서 넣은 클릭노동일 뿐인 내용에 지나지 않는 느낌이다.
사이가 나쁜 사람이 관직을 받을 경우 그것을 시기하거나, 복수를 위해 궁정에 결투를 신청하러 온다던가, 유물을 찾는 모험을 후원해달라고 온다던가 하는 경우도 있기는 하다. 생각해보면 무덤 도굴한 궁정의사나 궁정사제의 발냄새 같은 이상한 이벤트 같은 것만 쳐낸다면 내 궁정에서 하는 활동이나 주군의 궁정에 가서 하는 활동이나 내용 면에서 썩 나쁘진 않은 것 같기도 하다.

그래도 이런 안건에만 치중한 것보다 인물 간 상호작용에 좀 더 신경쓸 수 없었나 하는 아쉬움이 너무 큰데,
적어도 연회를 개최했다면 기존처럼 텍스트만 뜨는 것이 아니라 궁정에서 연회를 하는 모습 정도는 보여줘야 하는 것 아닌가...



------내용 추가------

3~4시간 정도 플레이 했을 땐 유물과 문화 시스템은 만족스러웠어도 궁정 내에서 그 누구랑도 궁전 전용 상호작용이 되지 않고 야외에서 하던 상호작용만 가능하다는 것에 상당히 실망했었는데,

10시간 정도 해보니까 궁정 안건이나 궁정 팝업 이벤트에 상당히 공을 들인 것이 보였다.

앞서 서술한 궁정사제의 발냄새나 궁정의 똥냄새같은 단순히 귀찮기만 하고 별 쓰잘데기 없는데다가 계속 떠서 짜증을 돋구는 문제는 단순히 기본 궁정이 더러워서 생기는 문제였다. 이는 궁정을 개조하면 해결이 되었다. 이런 이벤트가 귀찮다고 비판한 것은 상식이 부족해서 생긴 문제였던 것 같다.

그리고 우리 아빠의 원수 죽여버리겠어 하면서 감히 왕에게 결투하러 오는 애들은 보디가드를 고용하니까 빈도가 줄었는지는 몰라도 몇시간 째 더 이상 오질 않는다.

유로파4에서 식민지 개척 플레이를 하면서 정말 훌륭하다고 느꼈던 것은 꼬인 권역을 팝업 이벤트로 맞춰주는 시스템이었는데, 잉글랜드로 개척을 하다보면 캐나다와 미국의 권역이 항상 꼬인다. 이를 이벤트로 합법적으로 양도시키면서 판도를 깨끗하게 만들 수 있는 것이 좋았다.
이 점이 이 DLC에도 도입이 되어 공작령 권역이 더러우면 맞춰달라고 안건을 올린다.
합법적으로 안전하게 해결할 수 있게 된 것인데 판도충에게 이만한 선물은 없을 것이다.
물론 자주는 뜨지 않고 정말 가끔 뜨는 것 같다. 그것만으로도 괜찮다.

그 외에도 전장에서 공을 많이 세운 기사가 자신은 그렇게 공을 많이 세웠는데 왜 변변한 공도 못세운 귀족들이 혜택은 다 보냐며 내 땅을 떼어달라는 게 아니라, 아무것도 한 게 없는 귀족의 땅을 합법적으로 떼달라는 것에서도 아~ 이게 사람사는 세상이구나 하고 느꼈다.

이외에도 명분 보유자가 명분만 들고 오는 것이 아니라 즉시 전쟁 자체를 요구한다던가 능력치가 출중한 문객이 찾아와서 특정 직종으로 채용해달라던가 우리 할머니 유품 돌려달라던가 여러가지 다양하고 나름 재밌게 만든 것들이 간간히 뜨긴하지만 다 적긴 어려울 것 같다.

궁정에서 귀족들과 친목을 다질 생각에 부풀어 있었다가 막상 켜보니 상호작용 안 되는 것 때문에 내가 1년 이상 기다린 결과물이 이것인가 하고 분노했었는데 패독겜은 역시 오래해봐야 그 진미를 느낄 수 있다는 것을 다시 한번 느끼게 됐다.

109823951.review:
A few bugs and a tad overpriced, but otherwise a great addition to CK3. It finally feels like CK3 is on par with where CK2 is, and I'm finding less and less reason to go back to CK2 now. Which is a good thing, because I thought CK3 on release really didn't measure up to what CK2 could do. Royal Court adds (and expands upon) the remaining major features of CK2, particularly Conclave, and as an added bonus it really rethinks the culture concept by adding the much-needed feature of languages to the game.

CK3 is now where it should be, albeit with a steep price tag.

既没有增加核心玩法，也不能提高沉浸体验，就这点玩意还敢买90？本体打折也才90出头啊。 
宫廷里人物死板僵硬就在那呆站着，宝物堆在过道旁，好像这里不是宫廷而是博物馆。玩家视角还是固定的，自由视角得靠mod。除了拖慢游戏速度这玩意有啥用，难道蠢驴觉得玩家会没事干盯着宫廷看，还觉得自己当个国王在宫廷里养这么多木头人很有成就感很爽吗，我为啥不在大地图上欣赏我帝国的辽阔疆域呢，看海都比看你这宫廷强。 
文化才算是这DLC真正有价值的改动，做出了ck2所没有的东西，区别了不同文化之间的游戏体验，这一点没得黑。但我觉得文化部分内容还是少了，得继续深挖。目前文化之间的差异主要还是集中在buff方面，但维京文化和法兰西文化之间的差异绝不是几个兵种，几个buff，几个事件啥的就可以概括得了的。
感谢评论区老哥提醒，家徽设计器还可以。但我还是想看到更多历史家徽。这游戏都发售快一年半了，科穆宁还是顶着个核辐射的家徽。马其顿倒是改了，不过是从黄底黑号角变成了绿底白斜杠，蠢驴算是"用心"了，终于没再让堂堂马其顿家族NTR别人的家徽
我当初就不该预购啥豪华版，游戏发售都一年多了，第一个大型DLC就这，90块钱真的不值。明明本体搭的骨架还行，填肉怎么填的又烂又慢，蠢驴你V3豪华版预购没了 :)

109822281.review:
Why is this $30? It's the most expensive DLC Paradox has ever made, yet it offers less new content than Emperor for EU4, which cost "only" $20 at launch. Are they genuinely trying to imply that this DLC has 3/4's the content of base CK3, which is $40? I know inflation's been rising, but this is ridiculous. 

Not to mention that this took about... 8 months longer than it should've to make. Devs said it was because of COVID... Uh, yeah? The entire world's been dealing with COVID for almost two years now, guys. I get that it takes time to adjust to at-home workflow, but this is a frankly appalling level of productivity. Is it because of the 3D court? Did someone have to learn how to model 3D interiors from scratch in the Clausewitz engine? Because, I'm gonna level with you, it wasn't worth it. 

If this DLC was $20 or less, it'd be an... acceptable deal. The features it adds are incredible for modding, and future official updates. For CK3's sake, I hope that this unbelievably long development cycle was an aberration, and the $30 price point was because some C-Suite moron thinks a price increase means more profit, and not because the developers believe they make $30 of content.

tl;dr: A high quality update, marred by a comical $30 pricetag and an ungodly long development cycle. Not the worst DLC PDX has made by a longshot.

This expansion made the game unplayable for mr. 109820822.review:
Habiendo jugado cientas de horas el juego base y habiendo probado las nuevas características, si tengo que juzgar este DLC por lo que agrega (y obviando lo que trae el parche de forma gratuita), no puedo recomendarlo, especialmente si se toma en cuenta el precio.

-La corte en 3D: lo bueno es que da nuevos eventos para pasar el tiempo en momentos de paz e interactuar con los vasallos, lo malo es que me parece innecesario que sea en 3D (se perdió mucho tiempo en los gráficos que se podría haber dedicado a algo más importante) y, peor aún, que no haya opción de desactivarla manteniendo el resto de los eventos y elementos de grandeza (sólo se puede desactivar opciones visuales para dejarla llena de maniquíes petrificados). Lo más importante son los nuevos trabajos en la corte, que permite emplear a más cortesanos y mantenerlos contentos, pero eso también es parte del parche gratuito.

-Inspiraciones: interesante pero no mucho más, especialmente considerando que la parte importante (artefactos e inventario) son parte del parche gratuito.

-Reformar-Divergir Cultura y Culturas Híbridas: probablemente lo más interesante que agregue al juego base, aunque lo más importante (ética, pilares y tradiciones) son parte del parche gratuito. Personalmente, lo veo como una complejidad extra en un aspecto que no hacía falta ahora, ignorando elementos que están mucho más necesitados de mejoras como el combate, relación con los vasallos e incluso la religión (especialmente catolicismo y islam).

-CONCLUSIÓN: un buen parche gratuito con buenas adiciones, pero un terrible primer DLC (que es lo que estoy reseñando) en el que se perdió el tiempo de desarrollo (no olvidar que se postergó varios meses) en crear un escenario 3D que no me parece necesario (ni creo que el resultado final haya sido muy bueno incluso con la configuración gráfica al máximo) y pequeñas opciones extra sobre lo que se agrega gratuitamente que difícilmente justifica el precio de este contenido. Yo lo recibí como parte de la Royal Edition (pagado hace 1 año y medio), pero de haberlo tenido que adquirir de forma separada me hubiese parecido una gran decepción, por lo que recomiendo a quien este interesado en adquirirlo, esperar a una buena oferta ya que para nada lo considero imperativo (especialmente viendo todo lo que agrega el parche 1.5 de forma gratuita).

109820122.review:
I believe that this DLC is exactly what CK3 needed at this moment. Now, it feels like a truly immersive game. CK3 at launch felt somewhat stale and flat, and while a great game I don't regret buying, not something I could play long term for huge amounts of time. The game, I can now say after playing for a few hours, feels far more complete. It feels whole, and for that reason I could not recommend it more. So glad to have this, thanks Paradox!

An edit to be made after I slept on it: The game finally feels like a game about characters, and not just a game about the realm. The realm is of course very important, but the people inside the realm has always interested me more, and it seems like the game has focused on that.

For example, while holding court, I welcomed a rather incompetent man to serve as a knight to me. By the time that ruler died, the Knight was middle aged but actually rather talented, he learned blademaster trait. And then I heard him whispering to my wife a love poem and so of course I banished him from the realm. The man who started out serving William the Conqueror died childless in a battle for the French king against the Holy Roman Empire.

109819680.review:
Not a bad DLC by any means, yet immensely exorbitant, even by Paradox standards. 

Given the strength of CK2's swansong "Holy Fury", the quality of base game CK3, and the countless months the dev team spent working on this project, most fans were likely yearning for something expansive and impressive for the first major DLC release. Instead, we are given a bucket-full of gimmicks emanating minimal flavor, with nearly all of the interesting mechanics relegated to the free update. With the sole exception of diverging/hybridizing culture, "Royal Court" evinces the quality of a money-grab. 

A couple of shallow aesthetic changes (3D court-room, new crowns & apparel, etc.) paired with one legitimately interesting feature should NEVER cost over half the price of the base game. Paradox, once again, has started another series down the road of overpriced and predatory DLC practice. I can't say I'm surprised, but I sure am disappointed.

If Paradox wants to release CK3 DLCs that are twice as expensive and take twice as long to release as most CK2 DLCs, they better improve the quantity and quality of their content; lest this game continue to shed player interest and die an early death.

Et pour ma part, je n'ai senti aucune immersion ajoutée tellement ces nouvelles fonctionnalités sont des simulacres de roleplay d'une pauvreté abyssale, n'étant qu'un artifice utilisé pour le combler le vide ! En seulement quelques heures, j'ai réussi à me lasser de cette fonctionnalité. 
La seule nouveauté sympathique est l'hybridation des cultures, mais cela ne justifie en aucun cas le prix. 
Enfin bon il m'aura fallu quelques petites heures pour m'ennuyer à nouveau et retrouver la lassitude des sempiternels patterns que l'on découvre bien trop vite malheureusement.
Je désinstalle !

109819168.review:
Very disappointed with the time it took to make this DLC + upped price that this was what we got... And this is coming from someone who enjoys roleplaying campaigns.
- The Royal Court is just a massive money drain with little benefit. Is -12 gold per month worth a 1+ prestige, slightly better stress and hiring cheaper guests? Also really, we can't customize our court at all beside hanging up some artifacts?
- Diverging/Hybridizing cultures is so unfulfilling right now. Beyond some minor stat boosts, you're hardly changing up your experience at all.
- Artifacts are just mediocre stat boosts that will just bloat your inventory slowly degrading into nothing. Beyond a few mythical artifacts like the ark of the covenant, there is nothing here that really stands out. CK2 had a handgun, glasses, necronomicon, mjolnir, plate armor and so many other unique artifacts. I get that CK3 is trying to be a little more... 'realistic' but right now artifacts are just boring and mediocre ones far too frequent. I preferred when Crusader Kings had a supernatural aspect.
- One thing I did like about this DLC was holding court and having vassals petition you on various issues that require your involvement. I for once in a long time actually felt invested in others beyond my direct family. Also you can actually play passive without being bored out of your mind... Or atleast until all the new events become redundant.
EDIT: It's already become redundant... Seeing the same several court petitions over and over again.

Free Update - 8/10 Great additions this game really needed.
Paid DLC - 6/10 Underwhelming content that definitely isn't worth $30.

Get it on sale for -50% off because that's what it's worth. Would've refunded this had I not gotten it with Royal Edition. Hope Paradox reverts their decision to make future expansions $30 or I guess I'll be avoiding them in the future.

109818145.review:
Consiglio di prendere il DLC solo in sconto: aggiunge diverse cose nuove da fare e varie meccaniche interessanti nella gestione della corte, ma non vale affatto il prezzo pieno!

PRO:
- Tante novità di gameplay
- Artefatti da creare, cercare, rubare agli altri sovrani ecc...
- Tanti nuovi eventi
- Nuovi ruoli a corte (antiquario, fabbro, giullare, assaggiatore ecc...) che vi permetteranno di reclutare molta nuova gente e aumentare esponenzialmente gli intrighi e gli inciuci

CONTRO
- Riunire la corte sembra bellissimo all'inizio... ma dopo un paio d'ore di gioco vi sarete quasi scordati della sua presenza... ^^"
- Esteticamente la sala del trono è davvero brutta: modelli legnosi, stanze spoglie, luci fredde e artificiali... ok, potete vedere i vostri oggetti e reliquie sui piedistalli in mezzo alla stanza, ma in un gioco nel 2022 l'aspetto grafico lascia davvero a desiderare :-/
- Lancio del dlc disastroso: salvataggi incompatibili, bug grafici assurdi, conflitti vari coi driver delle schede video e con gli aggiornamenti Windows (un sistema operativo di nicchia... perchè Paradox avrebbe dovuto verificarne la compatibilità prima del lancio?), crash vari ecc...

Alla fine della fiera il DLC è simpatico, ma non vale assolutamente 30€: ci vorranno settimane di patch prima che possa essere anche solo giocabile in modo stabile, quindi non abbiate fretta di prenderlo... ^_-
(Anche perchè le Mod avranno bisogno a loro volta di varie settimane per essere aggiornate... e non fate i vaghi: TUTTI giochiamo con le mod! XD)

Ci vuole pazienza

Time would have been better spent adding mechanics of substance. They could have added standard event pop ups, with new 2D back drops, and you'd have largely gotten the same content. I'd rather them have spent more money on hiring game devs and less time worrying about adding all these 3D court rooms that ultimately just don't add much more than the same events, with 2D back drops, could have done. More importantly, courts are just a handful of static rooms. The only customization you get to do is assign 7 or 8 items to preset locations within the court. That's it. That's the extent of the customization. The "Hold Court" events quickly become repetitive with the same 4 or 5 events, that have largely negative and uninteresting results, triggering every time you use the decision. After the first 6-7 hours of playing with RC, I don't even use the Hold Court button anymore because of this.

RP focused players will likely feel differently. I just don't feel a year of dev time was worth it for what replay value we did get out of it. 

The biggest problem is that it doesn't really feel like a major DLC even though I'm sure they did spend a lot of time on it.

109815707.review:
La cambios en la cultura me gustaron, incluso diría que es lo mejor que trae. Antes del DLC, las culturas solo servían para dar opinión negativa a personajes de diferentes culturas a la tuya y poco más. Con los cambios no solo que esta mecánica se mejora, porque ahora las opiniones en base a la cultura se pueden modificar en bases a eventos y acciones, sino que se agregan otras nuevas. Las culturas ahora tienen diferentes tipos de bonificaciones: La Ética, los pilares culturales y las tradiciones.  
La ética tiene una solo bonificación modificable, los pilares son 4, pero solo 1 es modificable y las tradiciones son 5, siendo los 5 modificables. Pero hay creo que hay un problema: Las modificaciones son muy caras. Para modificar cualquiera de estas bonificaciones necesitas gastar prestigio, en el caso de la ética son 20.000, en el caso de las tradiciones es variable (Algunos cuestan 2.000 y 3.000, pero la mayoría cuesta 5.000 y 7.000) Para un gobernante tribal, que usa prestigio para comprar y mantener hombres de armas, construir y declarar guerras, es prácticamente imposible modificar la cultura. En caso de un gobernante feudal es un poco más accesible. 
Para cerrar los cambios en la cultura está la inclusión de los idiomas, los cuales están completamente desaprovechados, ya que solo sirven para ganar una pequeña opinión positiva de personajes que hablan la lengua que aprendes. 
En cuanto a la corte y los nuevos puestos menores, es lo peor de este DLC. Las cortes solo están desbloqueadas para reyes y emperadores de gobierno de clan o feudal, las arquitecturas de las cortes son pocas, la personalización que le podes hacer a la corte es muy superficial, el prestigio de la corte no está bien planteado, etc. 
Los puestos menores de la corte son algo interesante, pero muy desaprovechado. Primero, no entiendo que elementos hacen que un personaje sea mejor opción para un determinado puesto. Es algo que ya me pasaba con el médico de la corte, había veces donde buscaba a un médico y las opciones que me presentaban ninguna tenía el rasgo de médico, pero para el juego había uno que era mejor para el puesto que otro. Con este DLC es lo mismo, pero en vez de ser un puesto son más de una docena. Y Segundo, muchos de los puestos son inútiles; especialmente los puestos reales, donde la mayoría solo da prestigio para tu corte, por lo que si son un rey con gobierno de clan son puestos inútiles.
En cuanto a los artefactos, están bien.  
En definitiva, creo que el DLC tiene ideas interesantes, pero las plantea mal, como las cortes y los idiomas, o los platea bien pero podrían ser mejorados, como los puestos menores de las cortes y las culturas. También me parece que para lo que termina ofreciendo es muy caro, más si consideramos los bugs y errores de traducción en el caso específico de la traducción española.

109813250.review:
Fantastic DLC that adds tons of new RP potential and more depth to the RPG aspect of the game. The inventory system is fantastic and establishes a strong framework for modding and future DLC whilst the court system is full of potential for rewarding (and punishing) your courtiers. Cultural divergence is game changing for those who want more empire customisation. 

You'll see complaints about the 3D throne room but this is a fraction of the new content they added and probably the least impactful of the changes. If you're on the fence you can pick the DLC up for cheaper on CD Keys. What Royal Court does especially well (besides the extra flavor and strategic depth) is build a foundation for future expansions and modding and the future is looking bright. If you're already invested in CK3 this is a no brainer but shop around and get it cheaper elsewhere.

109812897.review:
Dans l'ensemble le DLC est plutôt bon et participe a donner, petit à petit, une identité propre à CK3 avec des éléments uniques. Ici c'est clairement le côté roleplay qui est le plus mis en avant, avec des events, de nouvelles interactions avec les membres de votre cour, et une gestion approfondie de celle-ci à travers un nouvel onglet. On peut noter cependant, que si on ne veille pas a aller faire un tour de temps à autres dans cet onglet on peut facilement passer à coté de pas mal du contenu ajouté, ce qui parfois donne un peu l'impression que tout cet aspect du jeu est optionnel et pas très "organique".
En même temps vous avez désormais accès aux reliques et autres objets qui vont participer à la renommée et au prestige de votre cours, et qui pour certains pourront être équipés par votre avatar qui possède désormais un inventaire. Une fois de plus tout cet aspect participe à renforcer le roleplay à micro-échelle.
L'aspect le plus intéressant du DLC est la refonte du système de culture qui, lui, possède une incidence constante et à grande échelle. Il se rapproche un peu du système de religion, vous pourrez désormais modifier votre culture, voir en créer une nouvelle. Les traits accessibles sont relatifs à divers facteurs, vos lois, votre situation géographique etc. Dans l'ensemble les cultures deviennent un aspect intéressant du jeu, que ce soit pour le côté roleplay ou même comme facteur a optimiser dans un run un peu tryhard de coloriage de la carte.

Bref, les nouvelles fonctionnalités sont pour certaines vraiment pas mal et il y a pléthore de petites additions qui mises bout à bout sont plutôt sympas.
Compte tenu du prix du DLC c'est difficile d'estimer si il est à conseiller ou non. Tout le monde l'aura remarqué, 30 balles c'est pas rien pour un dlc juste "sympa", c'est le prix d'un jeu. Après si vous êtes habitués aux jeux paradox vous savez déjà que c'est un hobby coûteux, et vous avez déjà eu plus d'une occasion pour vous offusquer de la politique économique de ce studio de bandits suédistanais, même si là, la note est particulièrement salée. A vous de voir si il vous faut votre dose tout de suite ou si vous pouvez attendre un peu pour les soldes.

109812435.review:
I'm conflicted whether to rate this positively or negatively. On one hand, I really like the hybrid culture system that came with this update and the new customizable coat of arms. But at its core, this is supposed to be about the royal court, so is it a success in that regard?

I'd probably say, uh, not so much... My main problem with it is that the court feels extremely lifeless. You're essentially looking at a still shot from different angles, in which case I really wonder why have an environment of this type at all when you could do some an easier and more stylistic representation (that already exists in the game as events!). Is it cool that you can display artifacts in your court? Yes, it is cool, but unless you're actively going into the court to look at it or for the limited-time events, there's not much reason for you to be there. And I have a feeling it's going to wear off and become irritating busywork extremely fast.

The worst part about it is that it's not actually more dynamic than the normal event system. The NPCs aren't moving and you don't even see thing from the perspective of the ruler. Instead of feeling like a visual novel, it feels like playing an isometric game. Again, it's worse than the original solution they came up with which has existed in the game since launch.

Ultimately, was an ambitious idea; but I'm not sure it's one that merited this much work when so many other areas of the game are either broken or desperately lacking. If you asked me to make a wishlist about what I wanted to see added to vanilla CK3, this court room display wouldn't even be on the list. I genuinely think the only reason they held back hybrid cultures and coat of arms was because they didn't want people to feel as underwhelmed about this expansion as it actually is.

109811424.review:
This DLC introduced some really odd and extremely ahistorical changes:
1. Characters of Balto-Finnic cultures (Estonians, Finns) look fully Asian in most cases, that is completely inaccurate. Swedes and Finns are literally from different races in the game. While in reality they looked indistinguishable in 1000AD and 2000AD. 2. With the new DLC, Estonian and Latvian cultures now follow the modern 2022 border between Estonia and Latvia. In reality, Latvia was half Finnic in 867/1066AD and this change was done just now.

I don't know what the devs were thinking but turning Finnics into Asians and changing the cultural borders to match 2022 borders instead of the actual borders in 867 really messed up the immersion/accuracy in North-Eastern Europe.

I am going to keep this short, so it is easy to read and hopefully you as a buyer of the game will get some value. 
Is this worth buying to see the court - No!

It is a 3d room, all interactions however are still text based. Frankly you can simply by using your imagination conjure a better court. You have to be at least a king before you will even see the court, Basically until you get to the feudal age the whole 3d thing is a non-event. That is not to say, they have not added a ton of new and exciting game play elements because they have. But honestly the court looks and feels like it was a brain-fart that some executive in Paradox decided would make the game better! 

Is it worth buying for the extra depth, yes!
As I bought the game pass I really did not notice the price. Seeing the DLC price at almost as much as the game itself I am forced to changed my answer...
Is it worth buying for the extra depth - No!

They add in royal court which is only available for kingdoms and empires but not for counties and duchies. Why cant they have royal courts and present within them city vasals, courtiers and guests?

With free update you can establish tradition within your culture wich is great. With DLC you can create your own culture wich costs too much and is basicaly just a surface level change, just like religion everyone can have same options with same bonuses with possible minner differences (for instance Indian cultures can have one cultural bonus for Elephants that other cultures can not have).

109810867.review:
Прошу прощения за недостаточную глубину, так как мой обзор на игру в удовлетворительной мере раскрывает подробности. Следует сконцентрироваться на инновациях ДЛС:
I. Двор. 
Доступен только феодалам от короля и выше, что автоматически делает его недоступным для львиной доли персонажей на карте. Тем же, кому он доступен, доставляет только удовольствие в виде нескольких событий раз в несколько лет.
II. Артефакты. 
Уже были представлены в предыдущей игре, хотя стоит отметить их переработку. В целом, полезная фича, хотя через добрую сотню-другую лет управлять гигантским складом музейных экспонатов станет невозможно. 
III. Культура.
Так как я не дегенеративный контент-мейкер, раннего доступа у меня не было, поэтому сужу по тому малому количеству часов, что успел наиграть: неплохо. Многие культуры все еще остаются плейсхолдерами, сама механика привязки культуры к технологиям все еще сосет, но это шаг в правильном направлении. 
IV. Дизайнер щитков. 
Просто шикарно.

Итог: CK3 не стала хорошей игрой, у нее все еще вагон и маленькая тележка проблем, однако Королевский Двор позволяет смазать некоторые неприятные моменты.

109806502.review:
The idea of language/culture mechanics really appeals to people who love that deep historical flavor but in this case it has translated poorly into gameplay. 

Paradox has written somewhere at their developers' meeting: "When in doubt, add more buttons." While I think that's a little harsh on them, unfortunately in this case it seems to be true. Let's take one example:

*Cultural Acceptance*

This is the new companion to County Control. If you have low cultural acceptance in your counties, it counts against you and you have to manage it exactly like County Control. There's absolutely nothing fun about it. Nothing new. It's actually a copy/paste mechanic that just exists to give you something new to manage. 

The same mindset bleeds over into the actual Royal Court. You can petition a liege once every 5 years (no cooldown or grace period if said liege dies - just once every 5 years and that's it). Your liege can reject or accept your petition with a consequence pop-up. 

I petitioned my liege to tour my capital county. Even though I was her Spymaster and she liked me, she refused. But then I received this message as the consequence:

"You lose 15 opinion of you." 

Thanks.

The new inventory mechanic is interesting on paper but there's some weirdness involved. Like your Emperor may wear a resplendent suit of armor and then when he dies, he passes it to his 1 year old son and his son is wearing it. Magical shrinking baby armor which the kid can't use anyway.

There are new interaction options for Sparring and Learning Languages. 

Languages are important because if you petition your liege and don't understand their language, you will sound stupid and they'll laugh at you. 

This makes some sense but once again, it just adds more meaningless button presses to make sure you're literally speaking the same language as your liege before petitioning them. And learning languages just takes up valuable time and resources, meaning you have to put off other things to learn the language to petition your liege who may reject you anyway and then for some reason you'll lose opinion of yourself?

The 3D throne room is ok. It's just ok. It does the job. It lets you see everyone's little gaggle of close friends and it has neat pedestals for artifacts. But honestly there are so many damn artifacts in the game that you'll get dizzy trying to keep them all straight. And they don't seem to matter a whole heck of a lot other than as eye candy because with a game that spans hundreds of years, you can't have a truly overpowered relic or it would just break the game. So they're just kind of neat.

Also, you can't utilize a throne room unless you're a King or Emperor or head of a clan. So if you were excited to maybe have your own palace or keep as a Duke or Count, it's not happening. You can still recruit the new flavor of courtiers but you don't get your own room to dress up and enjoy.

Small issues remain unfixed from the base game, like babies doing weird adult stuff all the time. I had an infant son get poisoned because he helped me wrap a poisoned package to kill the King. Then the King's infant son wore his dad's armor. Then when I killed that son, the infant Queen invited me to become Spymaster - so it was extra easy to kill her.

It's a decent add-on but it's just ok and it's worth $10, not $30. Even then, I'd probably hold off until there are some updates. Unless you just gotta have you some Culture/Language flavor, I would wait.

Games are defined by how many interesting choices they offer and there just aren't enough here to justify the price point.

109805175.review:
Так, у нас есть оригинальная третья часть, продолжения второй части. Из-за кучи ДЛС для второй части, третья была слабее на выходе, это понятно. Но мы же учитываем опыт и жадность параходов, так? Они же возьмут уже сделанные ДЛС ко второй части и интегрируют в третью, так? Мы будем получать небольшие ДЛС в течении всего года, так?
А не хера. Парадоксы выпустили одно плохое ДЛС с викингами и затем на ПОЛТОРА года ушли в запой. А знаете почему так долго? Потому что они делали ЧЕРТОВ 3D ТРОННЫЙ ЗАЛ. Они столкнулись с проблемами, ведь у них нет опыта делать 3D локации, а они так нужны в игре, состоящей из таблиц и текста. Они столкнулись с проблемами, ведь 3Д модельки с артефактами им пришлось изучать на предмет признаков старения. Они столкнулись с проблемами, ведь нужно создать звуки КАМИНА для фона. Это стоило того, что бы на ПОЛТОРА года оставить игру без контента, если Вы не фанат викингов, естественно. 

Геншин Импакт вышла в то же время что и Crusader King 3 и предоставила кучу бесплатного контента для игроков. Да, Геншин это выжималка денег через донаты, но за CK3 люди платили деньги сразу, особенно такие додики как я, которые купили расширенное издание и сидели с обрезанной версией предыдущей игры серии ПОЛТОРА года. Так к тому же у меня игра стала лагать и вылетать! Теперь я сижу и жду патчей.

Сначала Цива, теперь Парадокс, почему создатели крупных стратегий так не любят игроков и преданных фанатов?

109803969.review:
I made it very clear in my review for the base game that I'm very critical of how Paradox handled the switch from CK2 to CK3. This first DLC finally deliveres something which can be considered "new and improved" compared to CK2. At least Paradox try to move into new and unexplored domains in this DLC. Is it worth the hefty price tag? Well, absolutely NOT. Paradox have longe since abandoned offering DLC at DLC prices opting to sell them with a full game price tag instead.  
If you can look past this business practise and don't really care about the money you actually get something you haven't seen before in the CK series which is fun to play.  
  
Consequently, with the usual caveats about Paradox price policies in mind, this DLC is worth playing.

109803624.review:
Why? Whats the point of this DLC? The 3D court doesnt even look good and the lighting is off
The free update adds more to the game than this. For some reason the game considers Albanians to be Greeks? They made Central Dalmatia Serbian (Werent present in Dalmatia till the Ottoman conquests pushed them towards the north and west) and Bosnian (as a nation Bosniaks didnt exist till the 20th century) and for some reason also added Greeks (Byzantine citizens =/= Greeks, Greeks were never present in Medieval Croatia. The roman remnants lived in a few coastal cities and on the islands, and still were a minority compared to the Slavs). They also decided to make "Serbo-Croatian" a thing now in the game, also a 20th century creation. Whats next? The Soviet Union and Nazi Germany as formable Empires if you already are going towards including 20th century politics in a medieval simulator? Bollocks
Im glad that they added the Carantanians, who indeed were seen as a separate people in the middle ages and who, while being a small nation, did have their influence on Europe. But they do not speak "Serbo-Croatian". The 19th century language reforms didnt happen, rename it to "Old Church Slavonic" or something like "Old Slavonic", this is an insult to our intelligence. Primož Trubar and Matthias Flacius are rotating in their graves

Historical Immersion was never the goal of the dev team it seems. Most of the features from Ck2 are missing (like all of the bookmarks, playable republics, nomads etc.) Ck3 focuses heavily on the court but then again only has a small fraction of the events present in the previous game. Roleplaying is supposed to be the main part of the game, but I guess paradox didnt realise that its supposed to be "historical roleplay" and not just a LE reddit seduction backstab infanticide simulator set in a bland medieval timeframe

Its cringe to say that Imperator Romes map and UI are better than Ck3s, but its true. They try to make the game as pretty as possible but the models look like plastic dolls, the poses are all unatural and the skin and hair are shiny. Like a Second Life server with slightly better models. The second DLC for Ck3, the first one was absolute garbage and this one is just underwhelming looking at what modders make for FREE.

Is it so bad that its unplayable? No. Does it need improvement? Yes. What exactly? Better lighting and animations, remove 19-20th century politics from the game

109803030.review: After playing a good amount of time in this dlc, I have to say I am a bit disappointed. The changes to culture are fun and and depth to that aspect of the game, but it is a feature that could have easily been in from the start considering it is similar to the way religion customization functions. And then the may draw of this expansion, the Royal Court, is lackluster to say the least. Firstly, the fact that the are just a handful of preset courts seems a bit lazy for the price tag. Every court in the Mediterranean looks the same, every court in Northern Europe looks the same, etc. On top of that all the artifacts that you can acquire look relatively similar regardless of what tier they are. The artifact feature would have been made much better if there was more player customization in terms of what crafted artifacts look like and what kind of benefits you would like them to provide you with. Court events also seem a bit hollow, after a certain point I seem to just receive the same events on repeat with little variation. This is disappointing considering how engaging the events in Crusader Kings II were. All in all, I am still having fun with the dlc, but the amount of content does not justify the $30 price tag. I think it is only really worth it for those of us who received it at a massive discount by having the royal edition of CK III. I hope that future dlcs will get back to the core of the game and improve upon things such as the Crusades and managing your lands in meaningful ways like what was done with dlcs such as Holy Fury and Monks and Mystics in CK II.

109801701.review:
DLC bayağı iyi. En başında 3D Court ekliyor. Courtla birlikte 20 tane yeni ikincil saray ünvanı ekliyor. Seyisiniz, çeşniciniz(yemekleri tadan), şarabınızı kadehinizi dolduran hizmetçi, avcı başınız, korumanız, saray soytarınız, duellolar da savaştıracağınız şampiyonunuz, saray müzisyeniniz, saray şairiniz, antikacınız, öğretmeniniz, cellatınız ve sayamadığım bir kaç tane daha hizmetçileriniz oluyor. Hepsinin ayrı eventi var. Hepsi çok güzel. Ayrı ayrı buffları var. 

Oyuna dil eklendi. Artık dil öğrenip prestijinizi arttırabiliyorsunuz. Birden fazla dil öğrenebiliyorsunuz. Envanter sistemi ve artifact yani eserler eklendi. Envanter sistemiyle birlikte artık zırh, kılıç ve takı üretip bunları takabiliyorsunuz. Bunları üretmek için de demirciniz oluyor. Eserlere gelirsek her eserin değeri farklı. Muhammedin kılıcından tutun, savaşta kullandığı bayrağa kadar, charlamagne'in kafasından heykele kadar birsürü güzel eser var. Bunları isterseniz savaş açarak ele geçirebilirsiniz ya da çalabilirsiniz. Artık öldüğünüzde babanızdan kalan eserler için kardeşlerinizle çekişmeye gireceksiniz gerekirse savaş açacaksınız. 

Oyuna benim en beğendim özellik olan ve baştan aşağı oyunu değiştiren bir özellik olan kültürler geldi. Bu DLC'yle birlikte oyunda kültürler yokmuş diyeceksiniz. Oyunda biriktikçe harcayacağınız yer aradığınız ama bulamadığınız prestijinizi artık kültürlere harcayacaksınız. Çünkü kültür değiştirmek, yaratmak, melezlemek oldukça prestij yiyor. Bu da güzel bişey. İstediğiniz kültürü melezleyebilirsiniz. Atıyorum Greko-Oğuz (yunan - türk). Bu oluşturduğunuz melez kültüre istediğiniz ismi atayabilirsiniz. Her kültürün kendine has buffı ve debuffı var. Farklı farklı özellikler ekleyebiliyor. Çok güzel olmuş. Her save farklı bir oyunmuş gibi hissettirecek. 

Onun dışında coat of arms eklendi. Toprağınızın rengini, bayrağını, ve hanedan sancağınızı istediğiniz gibi birsürü sembol ve renkle değiştirebilirsiniz. Çok güzel olmuş. Daha burda saymadığım birsürü özellik geldi royal courtla. 10/10.

109800925.review:
I haven't been this excited for a DLC release since The Way of Life released for CKII. 

I've only been playing Royal Court for about an hour, but I can already tell that this was exactly the layer of immersion that was missing before. It's a story first and a game second to some of us, and the recent changes really help bring that story to life. 

Little things like being able to select the map color for your county or religion really add to the feeling that you are in charge and have the power to enact change. The addition of languages adds a fun RP element to foreign diplomacy, and the culture rework is straightforward and allows far more control over your populace. Court Eunuchs in England? Haha, why not?

My single biggest complaint is the lack of a free look in the court room (you have several angles you can view from and interact with people in your court, but you can't freely move the camera). As others have mentioned, the price is pretty steep but there are a ton of new coded events when you hold court as well as a new Court Language map layer and a myriad of new icon graphics. I'd recommend this to all die hard CK fans.

109799343.review:
Einführung

Royal Court und der Patch erweitern sinnvoll die Mechaniken von Crusader Kings 3 mit vielen neuen und schönen Features.
Im folgenden YouTube-Link zeige ich euch ausführlich in 40 Minuten die relevantesten Neuerungen im Detail.
Thronsaal, Hofpracht, Hofämter, Kultursystem, Inventar und Gegenstände, Bannereditor und Herscher-Gestalter usw. werden vorgestellt.

Nach den vorgestellten Videos erläutere ich Einzelheiten in Schriftform für die Lese-begeisterten unter uns.

YouTube Video (40 Minuten) Ausführliche Preview und vorgestellt.
https://youtu.be/YUH5QtBF6fI

YouTube Video (5 Minuten komprimiert) Preview Ausblick und relevantes in 5 Minuten vorschau.
https://youtu.be/zZVBQ9DYMZw

Crusader Kings III: Royal Court bringt viele Neuerungen

Das Highlight von Royal Court ist der Thronsaal, in dem Du und andere Personen in einer lebendigen 3D-Umgebung dargestellt werden.

- Der Thronsaal existiert in vier verschiedenen Stilen (Südeuropäisch, Nordeuropäisch, Muslimisch-Arabisch, Indisch), abhängig vom Standort bzw. Ihrer Kultur.
- Du hast außerdem die Möglichkeit, den Thronsaal noch zu gestalten bzw. auszuschmücken. Dazu gehören auch Artefakte, die dir Boni verleihen.
- Auch für das Gameplay spielt der Thronsaal eine Rolle, da du dort Bittsteller aus dem Volk empfangen kannst und neue Zufallsereignisse ausgelöst werden.
- Ebenfalls neu ist die HofPracht: Über Faktoren wie die Personen am Hof, Mode, Unterbringung und Verpflegung kannst du in der Prachtstufe aufsteigen,
was Gold kostet, im Gegenzug aber Ruhm bzw. Prestige bringt und weitere nützliche Vorteile.
- Dazu kommen Hofämter ins Spiel, darunter Titel wie Vorkoster, Stallmeister und Hoftutor.
- Charaktere sind nun außerdem in der Lage, Sprachen zu lernen, da das neue Kultursystem auch sprachliche Faktoren hinzugefügt hat und
am Hofe eine Amtssprache für das Reich gilt.

- Ebenfalls wichtig ist das neue dynamische Kultursystem. Dabei basiert jede Kultur (wie zuvor schon die Religion) auf drei Säulen, was eine genauere Ausgestaltung der kulturellen Identität erlaubt. Auf
diese Weise sind selbst Mischkulturen möglich. Viele Boni und Vorteile können durch das Erweitern der Traditionen einer Kultur erhalten werden, welches jedoch Prestige und Zeit kostet.

- Darüber hinaus gibt es ein umfangreiches Inventar und Gegenstandsystem. Wir können wertvolle Artefakte, Rüstungen, Waffen, Möbel oder Banner in Auftrag geben. Je nach Ereignissen und
Entscheidungen kann die Wertigkeit und die positiven Eigenschaften variieren.

Mein Persönliches Highlight ist im Ruler-Editor enthalten. Wir können nun endlich unser eigenes Banner/ Wappen der Dynastie umfangreich anpassen und gestalten.
Mehrere Farben, Muster und Varianten sind nun möglich ohne durch auswürfeln auf ein schönes Wappen hoffen zu müssen. Es sind kaum grenzen gesetzt.

[b]Eigene Meinung[/b]

Ob sich für euch die derzeit 30€ (Stand: 08.02.22) lohnen, könnt Ihr durch die Videos für euch selbst entscheiden.
Ich selbst würde die Erweiterung erst um die 15€-20€ erwerben, da viele der neuen Features auch im kostenlosen Patch enthalten sind. Das relevanteste Kernfeature mit dem Thronsaal, den Gegenständen und den neuen Zufallsereignissen wird erst durch das DLC Royal Court freigeschaltet.

The DLC is good, 3D spaces and characters make a huge difference in a game like this and you know this if you played the game for more than a couple of hours. 
Taking the series to 3D as much as possible and as quickly as possible should be the logical next step in an already deep role playing game such as this. Without ruining what works of course; and this DLC does not ruin anything.  
To people who say it is a "glorified event screen"; even tiny portraits in the previous game seemed to have a positive effect, people paid for them too, and now they look down at 3D spaces and characters, how quickly people forget these days. One thing about the price, it could be cheaper but then again most things could be cheaper.

109797597.review:
Crusader Kings 3: Royal Court adds plenty of flavor and introduces new ways to obtain bonuses for your realm while fleshing out how deeply you can interact with it. The feature that gives it its name isn’t as grand as it could be, due to repeating events and a 3D space that becomes a bit boring to look at even if you change its architectural style. 

Thankfully, the artifacts and culture system rework do make up for it. In tandem with its accompanying free patch, it’s a puzzle of many pieces that slot well into an already great base game. 

While I did enjoy my time with the expansion, it doesn’t feel like a vital purchase for someone who’s playing the game for the first time. But, if you’ve already guided several lords and ladies to glorious conquest or gruesome death, Royal Court provides a much-needed injection of new things to do that will spice up new playthroughs, at least for a while. 109797499.review:
TLDR: Full video review: https://youtu.be/qk4gbg7wd-g

Crusader Kings III Royal Court has been a long time in the making, but it’s finally here and has turned out to be one of the most game-changing expansions Paradox have ever released. Not only does it add a completely new visual space never seen before in these games, but the mechanics surrounding it are vast and exciting. From holding court to maintain realm relations, to artifacts, courtier positions, and the entirely new cultural system which gives so much more control to you, the player, Royal Court finally provides CK3 with a massive feature its predecessor did not already have. All in all, I cannot imagine playing CK3 without Royal Court now, and I think that says it all on both how awesome this expansion is, and how much CK3 was in dire need of more content.

[B]OVERALL SCORE:[/B] 7.5
[B]BEST FEATURE[/B] Highly customizable Cultures and the Artifact feature
[B]WORST FEATURE[/B] 30€ for 3 features is pricey

[B]SHORT REVIEW:[/B] I have played this DLC since it came out intensively and I have to say that only 3 major features were added. 

1º Personal Artifacts (Swords, Armour, etc, like in CK2)
2º The Royal Court itself that adds new random events and Court Arttifacts
3º Cultures that are pretty much like religion, and highly customizable

These features are all good to have around, but definetely not at the price of 30€. I would gladly pay 10-15€ at the very best. More than half of these were taken from CK2, making the culture rework pretty much the only thing that CK2 lacked in comparison with this DLC (CK2 also lacked the Royal Court, but the Royal Court is pretty much just a bunch of new random events with Artifacts that you can place around for extra modifiers, so nothing new, since Personal Artifacts already existed and so did Random Events).
